description: Creation of 2nd and 3rd floors to extend 2 self-contained flats and create 4 no self-contained flats, together with two storey front and rear extensions and associated refuse and cycle store.
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of the decision notice.Reason: To comply with the provisions of S.51 of the Planning & Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 3D perspectives 13D perspectives 23D perspectives 3Overshadowing Diagram 1Overshadowing Diagram 2A101A102A103A104A105A106A107A108A109A110A111A112A113A114A115A116Sustainable Drainage Strategy Flood Risk AssessmentBiodiversity Survey & ReportEnergy StatementReason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning

No development above existing ground level shall commence until details of the external finishing materials to be used are submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. A schedule of all materials (including photographs), samples, and their use in the approved scheme is required and 1-1 mock-ups must be made available on site. The development shall be constructed in accordance with the approved detailsReason: To ensure a satisfactory external appearance.

No development above existing ground level shall commence until details and samples of the surfacing materials to be used within the development including footpaths, access roads and parking areas and road markings have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The surfacing shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details before the development is occupied or use commences.Reason: To ensure that the development does not prejudice highway safety and a satisfactory appearance

No above ground works shall commence until details of high quality landscaping detailed design and specification, including hard landscaping, soft landscaping, boundary treatment, sustainable drainage, maintenance, enclosed and secure refuse store (including clear separation to residential and commercial sections), cycle stands, lighting design to enhance entrance sequence and improve perception of safety for residents has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The site shall be landscaped in accordance with the approved details in the first planting season after completion or occupation of the development whichever is the sooner. Any trees or shrubs which die, becomes severely damaged or diseased within five years of planting shall be replaced with new planting in accordance with the approved details.Reason: To provide a satisfactory appearance

The development shall be carried out in full accordance with the approved energy statement (Dated 14 March) unless otherwise submitted to and approved in writing by the Reason: In the interest of sustainable development and to ensure that the Local Planning Authority may be satisfied that CO2 emission reduction targets are met in accordance with Policy CP20 of the Enfield Core Strategy (2010), Policies DMD49, DMD50 and DMD51 of the Enfield Development Management Document (2014).

Following practical completion of works a final Energy Performance Certificate with accompanying Building Regulations compliance report shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Where applicable, a Display Energy Certificate shall be submitted within 18 months following first occupation.Reason: In the interest of sustainable development and to ensure that the Local Planning Authority may be satisfied that CO2 emission reduction targets are met in accordance with Policy CP20 of the Enfield Core Strategy (2010), Policies DMD49, DMD50 and DMD51 of the Enfield Development Management Document (2014).

The development must achieve reduced water consumption through the use of water efficient fittings, appliances and recycling systems to result in consumption equal to or less than 105 litres per person per day unless otherwise submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To promote water conservation and efficiency measures in all new developments and where possible in the retrofitting of existing stock in accordance with Policy SI 5 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy CP21 of the Enfield Core Strategy (2010).

All Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) of net power of 37kW and up to and including 560kW used during the course of the demolition, site preparation and construction phases shall comply with the emission standards set out in chapter 7 of the GLA's supplementary planning guidance "Control of Dust and Emissions During Construction and Demolition" dated July 2014 (SPG), or subsequent guidance. Unless it complies with the standards set out in the SPG, no NRMM shall be on site, at any time, whether in use or not, without the prior written consent of the local planning authority. The developer shall keep an up to date list of all NRMM used during the demolition, site preparation and construction phases of the development on the online register at https://nrmm.london/Reasons: In the interests of good air quality and protecting public health

Prior to the commencement of development, a Dust Management Plan (DMP), based on an Air Quality and Dust Risk Assessment (AQDRA), shall be submitted to and approved, in writing, by the local planning authority. The DMP shall be in accordance with The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition SPG 2014. The DMP will need to detail the measures to reduce the impacts during the construction phase. The development shall be undertaken in accordance with the approved plan.During each four construction sub-phases of the proposed development (demolition, earthworks, construction, and trackout), PM10 continuous monitoring shall be carried out on site. Parameters to be monitored, duration, locations and monitoring techniques must be approved in writing by the London Borough of Enfield prior to commencement of monitoring.Reason: To protect the local amenity from demolition/construction dust

The development shall not commence until a Construction Management Plan has been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The Construction Management Plan shall be written in accordance with London Best Practice Guidance and contain:o	A photographic condition survey of the public roads, footways and verges leading to the site;o	Details of construction access and associated traffic management;o	Arrangements for the loading, unloading and turning of delivery, construction and service vehicles;o	Arrangements for the parking of contractors' vehicles;o	Arrangements for wheel cleaning;o	Arrangements for the storage of materials;o	Hours of work;o	The storage and removal of excavation material;o	Measures to reduce danger to cyclists;o	Dust mitigation measures;o	Membership of the Considerate Contractors SchemeThe development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved Construction Management Plan unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure construction does not lead to damage of the nearby public road network and to minimise disruption to the neighbouring properties.

The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved cycle parking details as set out in  drawing A108 before the development is occupied. The cycle parking shall be retained and maintained as such for the lifetime of the development.Reason: To ensure the provision of cycle parking in accordance with Policy T6.1 of the London Plan (2021), the Council's adopted standards and London Cycling Design Standards Chapter 8

The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved refuse storage details as set out in  drawing A108 before the development is occupied. The refuse storage shall be retained and maintained as such for the lifetime of the development.Reason: To ensure the provision of refuse storage in accordance with the London Borough of Enfield - Waste and Recycling Planning Storage Guidance ENV 08/162

No mechanical plant shall be installed until an acoustic report, written in line with the methodology in BS4142:2014+A1 2019 assessing the noise impacts of the proposed plant, has been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The report must set out the sound level generated from the plant and state the noise control measures to be employed to ensure the noise from the plant room does not exceed a level of 5dB below the typical measured background noise level measured as L(A)90 15 minutes during operational hours, at the façade of the nearest or most noise affected residential property.Reason: To protect the local amenity from noise and disturbance

Prior to the commencement of above ground works, details demonstrating that the building can achieve 'Secured by Design' Accreditation shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to The development shall only be carried out in accordance with the approved details. Reason: In the interest of creating safer, secure, sustainable communities.

Prior to first occupation of the development, details of any external lighting proposed shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved external lighting shall be provided before the development is occupied.Reason: To ensure that the development does not prejudice the amenities of adjoining occupiers and / or the visual amenities of the surrounding area.

Prior to first occupation of the development, one parking space shall be provided with active vehicle charging and be available for use by future residents. Reason: To promote the use of electric vehicles and reduce carbon emissions, in accordance with Policy T6.1 of the London Plan (2021) as well as relevant Core Strategy and Development Management Document policies.

Prior to commencement of the development, a Tree Protection Plan showing how street trees adjacent to the site will be protected during construction, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development must only take place in accordance with the approved documents.Reason: To safeguard street trees adjacent to the development site which are of high amenity value.

Prior to occupation of the development, the sign signposting the residential entrance to the development shall be erected on site. Reason: To improve legibility of the residential entrance in the interests of better place making.

constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: LHA Maximum Height Level: All buildings, structures, and works exceeding 150 metres in height (492.1 feet).
LLA Maximum height level: All buildings, structures, and works exceeding 150 metres in height (492.1 feet)
